Color Class

Module
wijmo
File
wijmo.js

Color class.

The Color class parses colors specified as CSS strings and exposes their red, green, blue, and alpha channels as properties, making it easy to inspect, modify, and interpolate colors.


Constructor

Name Parameters Description
constructor(color)
  • color (string): CSS color specification.
 Initializes a new Color from a CSS color specification.

Properties

Name Type Description
a number Gets or sets the alpha component of this Color, in a range from 0 to 1 (zero is transparent, one is solid).
b number Gets or sets the blue component of this Color, in a range from 0 to 255.
g number Gets or sets the green component of this Color, in a range from 0 to 255.
r number Gets or sets the red component of this Color, in a range from 0 to 255.

Methods

Name Parameters Return Type Description
S fromRgba(r, g, b, a)
  • r (number): Value for the red channel, from 0 to 255.
  • g (number): Value for the green channel, from 0 to 255.
  • b (number): Value for the blue channel, from 0 to 255.
  • a (number): Value for the alpha channel, from 0 to 1. (default Value: 1)
 Color Creates a new Color using the specified RGBA color channel values.
S interpolate(c1, c2, pct)
  • c1 (Color): First color.
  • c2 (Color): Second color.
  • pct (number): Value between zero and one that determines how close the interpolation should be to the first color.
 Color Creates a Color by interpolating between two colors.
toString() string Gets a string representation of this Color.
